page.title: 17SHOPPING IN PUTTENHAM
page.content:
Twenty-five years ago there were five {shops in Puttenham;}a grocer, a butcher, a baker and a newsagent, as well as a large post office and general store.
In 1985 there is only one, a small newsagent which is also the Post Office. The nearest{shopping centres are in{Guildford or Godalming,}each of which is about five miles away.
Village residents, particularly pensioners without cars, find shopping very difficult as there is only one bus a day through the village to Guildford and no public transport to Godalming.
